subject: Psychology
title: Social Facilitation
description: A short lesson to help you apply Social Facilitation.

hook.text: A cyclist rides faster when racing others than when riding alone. The audience does something to performance.

buildup.text: Social facilitation is the oldest finding in social psychology â€” others' presence boosts performance on simple tasks.

discovery.text: Zajonc explained it: arousal from an audience strengthens dominant responses â€” helping easy tasks, hurting hard ones.

twist.text: This means an audience makes experts better and novices worse. The same presence has opposite effects.

climax.text: Practice alone, perform with others. That simple rule follows directly from a century of facilitation research.

punchline.text: An audience lifts experts and trips beginners.

quiz.question: What is social facilitation?
options: Others' presence boosts performance on simple or well-practiced tasks
